node.text:
US TikTok star Morgan Bullock has stepped into her dream role with renowned Irish dancing show Riverdance.

Days after her lockdown video featuring her lightning-footed jigs went viral, she was invited by Padraic Moyles, Riverdance's dance director, to join the show's cast.

#RiverDance #Dancing #BBCNews

node.title: Morgan Bullock makes professional debut in Riverdance

node.text:
"We have gone through many difficult days."

The only female whirling dancer in Afghanistan was about to start her biggest tour around the country. Then the Taliban took control.

The group sees Sufi whirling dervishes as against Islamic law so Fahima Mirzaei had no choice but to run. This is the story of her escape from her homeland.

#Afghanistan #Dancing #BBCNews

node.title: The escape of the whirling dancer

node.text:
"The more attention you pay it, the more it consumes your life and I don't want to consume my life."

Tom Parker from boy band The Wanted says he refuses to let cancer dominate his life, almost a year on from being diagnosed with an inoperable brain tumour. 

Tap the link in our bio to read more about the fundraiser he is planning at the Royal Albert Hall in London which will feature Ed Sheeran, Liam Payne and McFly as well as the first appearance for more than seven years by The Wanted. 

#Music #TheWanted #BBCNews

node.text:
“There were thousands of people on the pier and they rushed the ferry.”

When planes crashed into the World Trade Center on September 11th, tens of thousands were stranded on the island of Manhattan.

Boat captains of all types of vessels sailed into action. They rescued thousands of New Yorkers and whisked them to safety in what would become the largest US maritime rescue mission. This is their story.

#CutThroughTheNoise #BBCNews

node.title: The heroes of the forgotten 9/11 maritime evacuation

node.text:
Three Chinese astronauts have returned to Earth after completing the country's longest crewed space mission.

They spent 90 days at the Tianhe module on China's space station, some 380km (240 miles) above Earth.

#Space #China #BBCNews

node.title: "The universe is so vast, beautiful and fascinating."

node.text:
“When I’m watching it, it almost feels like that’s not me pulling off some of those shots.”

British teenager Emma Raducanu told BBC Breakfast about the "whirlwind" experience of winning the US Open.

The 18-year-old created history by becoming the first British woman in 44 years to win a Grand Slam singles title.

#EmmaRaducanu #USOpen #BBCNews

node.title: Emma Raducanu: ‘US Open win is still sinking in’

node.text:
"This website was essentially placing a bounty on the heads of women seeking abortions in Texas."

When the strictest abortion law in the US went into effect in Texas, teenagers took matters into their own hands. 

They took to social media to ask people to clog an anti-abortion website with fake tips about offenders.

They managed to bring the site down temporarily, but now the anti-abortion webpage, run by Texas Right to Life, is facing other challenges.

#TikTok #Texas #US #Politics #BBCNews

node.title: How TikTokers took down a Texas anti-abortion site

node.text:
A doctor combatting myths about the Covid vaccine on TikTok is calling for trainee medics to be given social media lessons within their degrees.

Dr Bnar Talabani is the only doctor from Wales on Team Halo, a UN-backed group of doctors and scientists using social media to dispel vaccine misinformation.

But the former refugee and co-founder of Muslim Doctors Cymru has been labelled "Dr Death" by trolls.

#Coronavirus #TikTok #BBCNews

node.title: TikTok doctor wants social media help for trainees

node.text:
"I felt powerless - I had no control over my life."

Millions are at risk of losing their homes after a temporary ban on evictions was overturned by the US Supreme Court. 

But the rental crisis existed even before the pandemic so what needs to happen to help those living on the edge? 

#CutThroughTheNoise #BBCNews

*The landlord of the Copycat has not responded to a request for comment

node.text:
“It’s just burnt the pastures right up.”

Canada's prairie provinces - agricultural heartlands - have been hit hard by drought. 

In the face of climate change, ranchers like Ryan Boyd are experimenting with new ways to work with nature and its extremes.

#Canada #Drought #BBCNews

node.title: Canadian prairie ranchers struggle with drought conditions

node.text:
Since the start of the pandemic, there’s been an increase in the production and smuggling of fake medicines around the world.

Authorities are cracking down on this type of crime and we were given exclusive access to a global operation led by World Customs in Benin in West Africa. 

The market for fake drugs is worth around $200bn worldwide every year. 

Since the operation began World Customs say it has seized more than 307 million illegal medicine items. 99.5% of them were discovered in West and Central Africa.

#Benin #BBCNews

node.title: On the trail of fake drug smugglers

node.text:
“I blame Larry Nasser, and I also blame an entire system that enabled and perpetrated his abuse.”

Elite US athlete Simone Biles has testified before the US Senate about abuse she suffered at the hands of the disgraced former team doctor.

"How much is a little girl worth?" asked Ms Biles, the most decorated Olympic gymnast of all-time.

Former teammates Aly Raisman and McKayla Maroney also appeared before the committee, along with FBI Director Christopher Wray.

The committee is examining shortcomings in the FBI's investigation into Nassar, who was convicted of sexually abusing girls. A report found numerous missteps and cover-ups by FBI agents, which allowed Nassar's abuse to continue for months after the case was first opened.

Tap the link in our bio to find out what the FBI said at the hearing.

#SimoneBiles #BBCNews

node.title: Olympic gymnasts give powerful testimony about abuse

node.text:
From dogs making a splash to an iconic Parisian landmark under wraps, here are some of the stories you may have missed this week.

#BBCNews

node.accessibility_caption: John Challis

node.text:
John Challis, best known for playing Boycie in British TV comedy Only Fools and Horses, has died aged 79.
 
His family said he died "peacefully in his sleep, after a long battle with cancer".
 
"He will always be loved for being 'Boycie' and leaves a great legacy of work that will continue to bring pleasure and smiles for many years to come," they said.
 
Tap the link in our bio to read about his acting career and his much-loved role as the second-hand car dealer in the popular sitcom.
 
#OnlyFoolsAndHorses #JohnChallis #BBCNews

node.accessibility_caption: John Challis
John Challis as Boycie in Only Fools and Horses

node.text:
US TikTok star Morgan Bullock has stepped into her dream role with renowned Irish dancing show Riverdance.

Days after her lockdown video featuring her lightning-footed jigs went viral, she was invited by Padraic Moyles, Riverdance's dance director, to join the show's cast.

#RiverDance #Dancing #BBCNews

node.accessibility_caption: Jimmy Greaves

node.text:
Former England striker and Tottenham's record goalscorer Jimmy Greaves has died at the age of 81.

He began his career with Chelsea before spells at AC Milan, Spurs and West Ham.

A member of England's World Cup-winning squad in 1966, Greaves scored 44 goals in 57 games during his international career, but famously failed to play in the final after Sir Alf Ramsey stuck with Geoff Hurst.

After his playing days ended in 1980, Greaves became a popular TV pundit and appeared as one half of Saint and Greavsie, alongside former Liverpool star Ian St John.

Tap the link in our bio to read more about his remarkable career.

#JimmyGreaves #Football #Tottenham #BBCNews

node.accessibility_caption: Jimmy Greaves
Greaves in his Tottenham kit

node.text:
The Drone Photo Awards of 2021 show off amazing bird's eye view of our planet.

Tens of thousands of people applied, from 102 countries, but the overall winner was Terie Kolaas from Norway.

Terie’s photo shows thousands of Pink-footed geese flying over Norway towards Svalbard in the arctic.

Categories in the competition include Urban, Wildlife, Sport, People, Nature. Abstract.

Tap the link in our bio to see more stunning photographs from the competiton.

(📷 Drone Photo Awards/ Siena Awards, photographer credits below)

Photo 1 - Terie Kolaas, Norway (Overall winner)

Photo 2 - Qasim Al Farsi, Omam (Wildlife)

Photo 3 - Gheorghe Popa, Romania (Abstract)

Photo 4 - Sergei Poletaev, Russia (Urban)

Photo 5 - Martin Sanchez, Russia (Nature)

Photo 6 - Trung Pham Huy, Vietnam (People)

node.text:
"We have gone through many difficult days."

The only female whirling dancer in Afghanistan was about to start her biggest tour around the country. Then the Taliban took control.

The group sees Sufi whirling dervishes as against Islamic law so Fahima Mirzaei had no choice but to run. This is the story of her escape from her homeland.

#Afghanistan #Dancing #BBCNews

node.accessibility_caption: A firefighter tackling wildfires

node.text:
The world is getting hotter.

The number of days where temperatures hit 50C+ has increased.

Temperatures of 50C happen predominantly in the Middle East and Gulf regions, but after record-breaking temperatures of 48.8C in Italy and 49.6C in Canada this summer, scientists have warned days over 50C will happen elsewhere unless we cut fossil fuel emissions.

The BBC's Life at 50C series investigates how extreme heat is affecting lives across the world.

Tap the link in our bio to learn more about the effects of extreme heat on Earth.

#ClimateChange #Environment #GlobalWarming #BBCNews

node.accessibility_caption: A firefighter tackling wildfires
A map of Earth shows temperature rises
Forest fires burn at night
A parched landscape
Photo by BBC News on September 18, 2021. May be an image of tree, outdoors and text.

node.text:
The world's largest tree has been wrapped in a fire-resistant blanket by firefighers.

General Sherman, which is nearly the same height as the Statue of Liberty and around 2,500 years old, is one of the thousands of trees in California's Sequoia National Park at risk from forest fires.
 
More than 350 firefighters are tackling the Colony and Paradise fires, which have been growing for a week.

To find out more about the forest-fires, tap the link in our bio.

(📷 National Park Service)

#US #California #ForestFires #BBCNews

node.text:
"The more attention you pay it, the more it consumes your life and I don't want to consume my life."

Tom Parker from boy band The Wanted says he refuses to let cancer dominate his life, almost a year on from being diagnosed with an inoperable brain tumour. 

Tap the link in our bio to read more about the fundraiser he is planning at the Royal Albert Hall in London which will feature Ed Sheeran, Liam Payne and McFly as well as the first appearance for more than seven years by The Wanted. 

#Music #TheWanted #BBCNews

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by BBC News on September 18, 2021. May be an image of outdoors and text that says 'BBC NEWS Idle taxis used to grow food for out-of-work drivers in Thailand'.

node.text:
In a car park in the Thai capital Bangkok, green shoots sprout from the roofs of colourful taxis.

Thailand's Covid-19 restrictions have left the city's streets quiet, putting taxi drivers out of work.

As fares dried up many drivers left the city, leaving so-called taxi graveyards behind.

Now, one company has decided to use the roofs of the idle vehicles as small vegetable plots, which they hope can help to feed out-of-work drivers and other employees.

Tap the link in our bio to read about the initiative.

(📷 EPA)

#Thailand #Coronavirus #Taxis #BBCNews

node.text:
“There were thousands of people on the pier and they rushed the ferry.”

When planes crashed into the World Trade Center on September 11th, tens of thousands were stranded on the island of Manhattan.

Boat captains of all types of vessels sailed into action. They rescued thousands of New Yorkers and whisked them to safety in what would become the largest US maritime rescue mission. This is their story.

#CutThroughTheNoise #BBCNews

node.text:
An art installation commemorating every American who has died from Coronavirus has opened in the nation's capital. 

The concept of artist Suzanne Brennan Firstenberg, more than 666,000 flags have been planted over 20 acres near the Washington Monument in Washington, DC.

It comes as a panel advising the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has recommended boosters of Pfizer's Covid-19 vaccine for people aged 65 and over.

It voted against approving a booster shot for everyone 16 and over, however.

The outcome is a blow for US President Joe Biden, who said widespread jabs would be available as early as next week if approved.

Tap the link in our bio to learn more. 

(📷 Getty Images)

#Coronavirus #US #BBCNews
